verses.roman:
maruttasya yathā yajño
na tathānyo 'sti kaścana
sarvaṁ hiraṇmayaṁ tv āsīd
yat kiñcic cāsya śobhanam

synonyms: maruttasya—of Marutta; yathā—as; yajñaḥ—performance of sacrifice; na—not; tathā—like that; anyaḥ—any other; asti—there is; kaścana—anything; sarvam—everything; hiraṇ-mayam—made of gold; tu—indeed; āsīt—there was; yat kiñcit—whatever he had; ca—and; asya—of Marutta; śobhanam—extremely beautiful.
translation: The sacrificial paraphernalia of King Marutta was extremely beautiful, for everything was made of gold. Indeed, no other sacrifice could compare to his.
